intro: Calystegia silvatica subsp. disjuncta, commonly known as the Disjunct Wood Morning Glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its disjunct distribution, with populations found in isolated regions across its range. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale purple. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
